column4: I'm having some issues getting eth0 to link up to the network. http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=11630323#post11630323 anything else I could try to troubleshoot?
I suggest you run:  sudo lshw -C network; lsb_release -a; uname -a     and add that to the entry
Thanks!
also try:  sudo dhclient3 eth0
make sure you have the lights flashing on the interface itself on both sides of the cable too
No lights on either end.
strange, should be
I would have to agree with you on that. I'd like to be able to narrow this down to a Hardware/Software issue. I'm hoping to exaust the software side first.
do you know the lan cable is good?
Step1: haha... I pulled it from the working connection between the windows file server and the router.
if you unload then reload the module. Is it ok?
What is the command to unload the sky2 module?
Also I'd assume it's a modprobe to reload it?
sudo modprobe -r sky2; sleep 2; sudo modprobe sky2
the pause gives the system chance to stop etc
Looks like I got lights... I knew it was the module...
ok is it connecting now?
if it does, add the command in /etc/rc.local above the exit 0   line and it will run automagically at boot.
It doesn't seem to be getting it's DHCP lease
is the interface still eth0?
if so, run:  sudo dhclient3 eth0
